response.overview: The documentary begins with archival footage of Tes and her son Anggo, after which it shifts to the present where Anggo cares for Tes as she battles breast cancer. When they discuss leaving their provincial home Anggo visits it one last time while Tes stays behind. Separately, they reflect on over a decade of Tesâ€™ cancer treatment and how their relationship has changed over the years.
response.title: Si Tes At Si Anggo
